fields.desc: A procurement audit. This is a example audit to show the features of this tool
fields.title: Procurement
Master data is up to date

fields.desc: Defective parts that are purchased have to be returned to the suppliers in a timely fashion
fields.title: Defects are returned timely

fields.desc: Purchase orders are entered into the system accurately and timely.
fields.title: POs are entered accurately

fields.desc: All purchase orders are entered into the ERP system.
fields.title: PO are all entered into the system

fields.desc: Defects that are not returned show incorrect stock values and incorrect financials
fields.title: Incorrect stock values

fields.desc: POs that have incorrect information tend to delay the purchasing process and also creates vendor dissatisfaction
fields.title: Delays and Vendor dissatisfaction

fields.desc: There is a deal of fraud that can happen when some of the POs are allowed to be skipped from being entered into the system.
fields.title: Purchasing fraud

fields.desc: Master data is the central reference of all processes with in the company. If this reference is not correct it will lead to inconsistencies for downstream processes such as manufacturing, accounting , etc
fields.title: Incorrect Master data

fields.desc: The manager in charge of inventory does weekly checks of high value items and monthly checks of lower value items.
fields.title: Weekly and Monthly stock checks

fields.desc: Defects that are to be returned are processed on a weekly basis.
fields.title: Returns are weekly processed

fields.desc: The warehouse has a specified area where the returns and defects are kept. This area is to be cleared on a weekly basis.
fields.title: Returns area in warehouse is checked

fields.desc: All POs are authorised according to a authorisation matrix. The number of signatures are to be checked before the PO is released and entered into the system
fields.title: All POs are authorised

fields.desc: All changes to the master data is authorised. There are two managers who will authorise master data changes in each department.
fields.title: Changes to Master data is authorised

fields.result_desc: All the stock verification reports for the period was found to be duly signed and dated.
fields.desc: Obtain the weekly and month stock verification report. Take a sample for the audit testing period. Ensure that the required managers have signed off on these reports.
fields.title: Stock verification report

fields.result_desc: All returns for the period were found to be processed on time. The physical inspection of the returns area in the warehouse was found to have items that were placed there less than a week ago.
fields.desc:
Obtain the list of returns that were processed for the audit testing period. Check to see if the returns date were done weekly and that there are no gaps.
Check to ensure that the returns were moved to the returns area in the warehouse. Ask to inspect this area.
fields.title: Returns process list

fields.result_desc: There were 378 POs that were created during the period. All POs from the sample were duly signed and dated
fields.desc: Obtain a list of POs for the period of testing. Ensure that the POs are all authorised and the authorisation is according to the authorisation matrix of the department.
fields.title: Check POs for authorisation

fields.result_desc: For the testing period, there were 30 master data changes. Of these 1 of the changes was found not to have any authorisation. There was no track that this change was even sent to a manager for change.
fields.desc: Obtain a list of all master data changes for the period under testing. Check to ensure that all changes are authorised by atleast 2 managers.
fields.title: Obtain changes to the Master data
Master data authorisation
fields.desc: There was one master data authorisation that was found not to have the correct signatures. It was also noted that this change did not seem to have been sent to a manager for authorisation
